SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Interface DeliveryRequirements

public interface DeliveryRequirements
Represents delivery requirements and preferences for a message.

This interface encapsulates all SMTP extensions that describe how the sender wants the message to be delivered. Unlike message content options (like SMTPUTF8 which affects parsing), these options affect routing and delivery behaviour.

Supported extensions:

  • REQUIRETLS (RFC 8689) - Message must only traverse TLS connections
  • MT-PRIORITY (RFC 6710) - Message transfer priority level
  • FUTURERELEASE (RFC 4865) - Hold message for later delivery
  • DELIVERBY (RFC 2852) - Delivery deadline with failure action
  • DSN (RFC 3461) - Delivery Status Notification preferences (RET, ENVID)

Note: Per-recipient DSN options (NOTIFY, ORCPT) are tracked separately via DSNRecipientParameters.

Handlers must respect these delivery requirements when relaying messages. Failure to honour REQUIRETLS or DELIVERBY constraints should result in bouncing the message rather than violating the sender's requirements.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • isRequireTls

      boolean isRequireTls()
      Returns whether REQUIRETLS was specified for this message.

      When true, the sender has indicated that this message must only be transmitted over TLS-protected connections (RFC 8689). If the server cannot guarantee TLS protection to the next hop during relay, the message must be bounced rather than delivered insecurely.

      Returns:
      true if REQUIRETLS was specified in MAIL FROM

    • getPriority

      Integer getPriority()
      Returns the message transfer priority level.

      MT-PRIORITY (RFC 6710) allows senders to indicate the relative priority of a message. Values range from -9 (lowest) to +9 (highest), with 0 being normal priority.

      MTAs may use this to prioritize message processing and queue management. Higher priority messages should be processed before lower priority ones when resources are constrained.

      Returns:
      priority level from -9 to +9, or null if not specified

    • hasPriority

      default boolean hasPriority()
      Returns whether a priority level was specified.
      Returns:
      true if MT-PRIORITY was specified in MAIL FROM

    • getReleaseTime

      Instant getReleaseTime()
      Returns the time until which the message should be held.

      FUTURERELEASE (RFC 4865) allows senders to request that a message be held for later delivery. This returns the earliest time at which the message should be released for delivery.

      If both HOLDFOR and HOLDUNTIL were somehow specified, this method returns the computed release time.

      Returns:
      the release time, or null if the message should be delivered immediately

    • isFutureRelease

      default boolean isFutureRelease()
      Returns whether the message should be held for future release.
      Returns:
      true if HOLDFOR or HOLDUNTIL was specified in MAIL FROM

    • getDeliverByDeadline

      Instant getDeliverByDeadline()
      Returns the delivery deadline for this message.

      DELIVERBY (RFC 2852) allows senders to specify a time limit for message delivery. If the message cannot be delivered within this time, action should be taken based on isDeliverByReturn().

      Returns:
      the delivery deadline, or null if no deadline was specified

    • isDeliverByReturn

      Boolean isDeliverByReturn()
      Returns whether the message should be returned if the deadline is missed.

      When DELIVERBY is specified with the 'R' trace modifier, the message should be returned (bounced) to the sender if it cannot be delivered by the deadline. When 'N' is specified, a delay DSN should be sent instead.

      Returns:
      true for 'R' (return), false for 'N' (notify), or null if no DELIVERBY was specified

    • hasDeliverByDeadline

      default boolean hasDeliverByDeadline()
      Returns whether a delivery deadline was specified.
      Returns:
      true if DELIVERBY was specified in MAIL FROM

    • getDsnReturn

      DSNReturn getDsnReturn()
      Returns the DSN return type preference.

      DSN (RFC 3461) RET parameter indicates how much of the original message to include in any Delivery Status Notification:

      • DSNReturn.FULL - Include the entire message
      • DSNReturn.HDRS - Include only the headers
      Returns:
      the DSN return type, or null if not specified

    • getDsnEnvelopeId

      String getDsnEnvelopeId()
      Returns the DSN envelope identifier.

      DSN (RFC 3461) ENVID parameter provides an opaque identifier that will be included in any Delivery Status Notification, allowing the original sender to correlate the DSN with the original message.

      Returns:
      the envelope ID, or null if not specified

    • hasDsnParameters

      default boolean hasDsnParameters()
      Returns whether DSN parameters were specified.
      Returns:
      true if RET or ENVID was specified in MAIL FROM

    • isEmpty

      default boolean isEmpty()
      Returns whether this is an empty delivery request with no special requirements.
      Returns:
      true if no delivery options were specified
